message_1: What is the maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 ml of water at room temperature?
message_2: The solubility of sodium chloride (NaCl) in water at room temperature (approximately 25Â°C) is about 36 grams per 100 milliliters of water. Therefore, the maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 ml of water at room temperature is approximately 36 grams.
